snippet: Besides Honda’s decision, United States traffic safety officials fined Takata an amount that could go as high as $200 million.
abstract: Honda Motor Company drops airbag manufacturer Takata after longtime business relationship, saying company presented false test data; announcement comes as National Highway Traffic Safety Administration fines Takata $70 million for failing to report safety defects in its airbags, millions of which have now been recalled, that led to eight deaths and over 100 injuries.

byline.original: By HIROKO TABUCHI and DANIELLE IVORY

lead_paragraph: Besides Honda’s decision, United States traffic safety officials fined Takata an amount that could go as high as $200 million.

headline.main: Honda Drops Takata as U.S. Issues Huge Fine Over Airbags
headline.print_headline: Honda Drops Airbag Maker Over Test Data
